description: A second death linked to the current flu season has been reported to the state Department of Health, a department spokesman said Monday.
title: Second Arkansas flu death of season reported
title_page: Second Arkansas flu death of season reported
text:
A second death linked to the current flu season has been reported to the state Department of Health, a department spokesman said Monday.
Spokesman Meg Mirivel said the latest death occurred over the weekend. Like the first person who died of the flu this season, on Oct. 16, the person who died most recently was between the ages of 45 and 64, lived in the southwest part of the state and had not been vaccinated against the flu this season, she said.
Last year, the first flu death of the season wasn't reported until late November, she said. A total of 227 people died of the flu that season, making it the deadliest in decades.
Last month, state health officials said they were seeing an unusual uptick in cases. But Mirivel said the level of activity as of Monday was lower than at the same time last year.
Metro on 10/30/2018
